1. \(t = 0.90 \text{min}\) and \(t = 2.9 \text{min}\)
2. \(t = 2.9 \text{min}\) and \(t = 3.5 \text{min}\)
3. \(t = 3.5 \text{min}\) and \(t = 4.5 \text{min}\)

kinetic energy =   .........
Calculate the force applied to stop the bus
Another bus travels at a speed of \(8.9 \text{m/s}\). The brakes apply a constant force and the bus stops in a distance of \(23 \text{m}\). This bus has a mass of \(18 000 \text{kg}\)
Define impulse
Show that the force exerted on the rocket by the exhaust gases is \(3900 \text{kN}\)
State the equation you use
Calculate the maximum mass that this force can lift from the ground. Ignore air resistance
maximum mass =   .........
Fig. 2.1 shows a rocket and its exhaust gases
The exhaust gases are emitted from the rocket with a velocity of \(1400 \text{m/s}\) and at a rate of \(2800 \text{kg/s}\)
Calculate the pressure on the road due to the weight of the car
pressure =   .........
Explain, in terms of particles, why the air pressure in the tyres increases when the car travels along the road
A car has a weight of \(13 000 \text{N}\). The car is supported by 4 tyres. The area of each tyre in contact with the road is \(0.016 \text{m}^2\)

A gas cylinder contains helium gas at a pressure of \(2.0 \times 10^{6} \text{Pa}\). A volume of \(0.026 \text{m}^{3}\) of the compressed gas is released from the cylinder into balloons. Each balloon contains \(0.015 \text{m}^{3}\) of helium at atmospheric pressure \((1.0 \times 10^{5} \text{Pa})\). The temperature remains constant
Calculate the maximum number of balloons that can be filled
maximum number of balloons =   .........
Define specific heat capacity
Calculate the mass of oil in the pan
Calculate the energy required to increase the temperature of the oil
Calculate the power required to supply the energy calculated in **(b)**(ii)
A volume of \(0.0024 \text{m}^3\) of oil is heated in a pan for \(7.0 \text{min}\). The temperature of the oil increases from \(20^\circ \text{C}\) to \(180^\circ \text{C}\)
The density of the oil is \(910 \text{kg} / \text{m}^3\). The specific heat capacity of the oil is \(2000 \text{J} / (\text{kg}^\circ \text{C})\)
Table 5.1 shows applications of regions of the electromagnetic spectrum
Complete the second column of the table with the region of the electromagnetic spectrum used for each application
Choose from the regions in this list:
gamma rays
infrared
microwaves
radio waves
ultraviolet
Each region may be used once, more than once or not at all

table.html:
applicationregion of electromagnetic spectrum
cancer treatmentgamma rays
Bluetooth data connection
optical fibres
security marking
sterilising food
wireless internet

Most of the alpha particles pass through the thin foil in a straight line
State the conclusion about atoms from this observation
Some of the alpha particles are deflected through angles less than \(90^{\circ}\) and a few are deflected through \(180^{\circ}\)

conclusion 1
explanation 1
conclusion 2
explanation 2
